name: CIMAC - Comunidade Intermunicipal do Alentejo Central
goal:
The Intermunicipal Community of Central Alentejo is a legal person of public law with a associative nature and that aims to achieve common interests to the municipalities that compose it.
The Intermunicipal Community of Central Alentejo is composed by the municipalities of Alandroal, Arraiolos, Borba, Estremoz, Évora, Montemor-o-Novo, Mora, Mourão, Portel, Redondo, Reguengos de Monsaraz, Vendas Novas, Viana do Alentejo and Vila Viçosa and belong to the territorial Unit Level III (NUT III) of Central Alentejo.
The area covered by these municipalities is 7393.4 km2 and whith a population of 166 726 inhabitants.
The CIMAC has worked towards the promotion and development, together with other associations of municipalities and other entities of the Region. The goal of CIMAC is to act strategically in diferent development sectors for is associated municipalities and to all the region of Central Alentejo.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Development, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Information Society, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport
